            Bio
            Juan C. Sanchez-Arias is a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Division of Medical Science at the University of Victoria. Trained as medical doctor and neuroscientist, Juan is currently researching the cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying cardiac arrhythmia and other central nervous system manifestations associated with a novel genetic variant in an ion channel adapter protein. His research approach combines clinical and model organism investigation, fixed and live cell microscopy, and computational modelling of protein interaction networks and cellular physiology. His other interests include systematic bio-image analysis workflows, open science, and science outreach and communication.
            
            
            Education
            University of Victoria | Victoria, BC, Canada
            Ph.D. in Neuroscience | January 2015 - April 2020
            Universidad del Valle, School of Medicine | Cali, Valle, Colombia
            Doctor in Medicine | August 2007 - September 2014
            
            
            Experience
            University of Victoria | Postdoctoral Fellow | August 2020 - Present
            Hospital Universitario del Valle ESE | Medical Intern | September 2013 - September 2014
            Centro de Estudios Cerebrales, Universidad del Valle | Research Intern | February 2014 - July 2014
            
            
            Memberships
            Canadian Cardiovascular Society | 2021 - Present
            Colegio Colombiano de Neurociencias | 2021 - Present
            Society for Neuroscience | 2016 - Present
            Canadian Association for Neuroscience | 2015 - Present
